I'm telling you, a day of reckoning is coming

Oh boy, the 3900X shortage is now being written about in articles
That ain't good for me, great for AMD, though
Yeahhh, microtransactions. When they've vacuumed up all the money, us peasants can just resort to trading bottle caps, right?
Let's not forgot that developers don't see a god damned cent of that money
It all goes into the publisher's coffers and the executives pockets
Yeah, the devs literally probably have to trade what little creative freedom they have for a direct conduit into the pockets of their fans. ;_;
"Oh you want to make a wholesome, innovative game that your fans will love? It better make us more money than MundaneWarfare 2019 ever did."
More or less, ALWAYS be wary of games coming from a studio backed by a publisher
It seems to be inevitable that the publisher will ultimately become a greedy powerhouse trying to please investors.
Well color me surprised if there will ever be enough backlash to solve this problem. Call me pessimistic but Apple never saw the consequences of their actions either
These companies have a history of not caring about either the consumer or the dev. They don't need to. People buy it anyway
In this case i hope that the governments of the different countries will be the ones to act on it. Cause it involves obvious gambling
There's a reason hardcore enthusiasts hate "normies"
They will eat any shit thrown their way without a second thought
For the true gamers who actually give a damn, there's a joke floating around
It goes something like this
When it came to buying games, it used to be "Wait for the reviews."
Then it became, "Wait for launch"
Then "Wait a few weeks"
Now it's becoming "Wait a few months"
Soon, it'll be "Wait forever" ;)
Haha
It's a sad reality of the gaming industry
It used to be you could trust the word of reviewers from gaming outlets, but then they became more interested in their agendas than actual reviews
Also, they can't play for shit :ptv-laugh:
So next, they advised waiting for launch, see what actual players who paid for the game said about it
Then games started taking advantage of online connections to push out broken games and fix them later
And now, if that wasn't bad enough, thanks to publishers like Activision, we have to wait MONTHS to know how badly a game's gonna screw over it's customers
It took 6 months, but they added super predatory microtransactions to Black Ops 4.
Not only did they incorporate loot boxes into the game, they also added P2W elements.  Recently, a 2nd gun exclusive to loot boxes was released with the same problem as the other one
The guns are so overpowered that they're effectively 1-shot kills.  And you can only get them through paid means
These kinds of overpowered guns will get nerfed eventually, but essentially you can just keep pulling the lever until you get a gun that hands you a serious advantage.
So yeah... not publishers are likely going to start waiting months until they drop all the predatory crap into their games.  Get the good will and good reviews cemented, then pull the wool.
Ugh, I swear, I'm just sick of predatory business practices going unpunished :ptv-unimpressed:

There are some requirements to be qualified as a resident, but there are only two types. Permanant and temporary.
Those like myself, Permanant residents, have the chat open in a window which allows us to both lurk and read all messages all the time that happen even when we are away.
We know everything. We see.. everything. :eyes:
Others, like the temporary residents, are not always here but usually come here during their free time after work or school, or when they are not sleeping.
Most people only come by for the streams, so they can't be called residents.
I think the term for them is called regular visitors.
You are free to be whatever you wish, there is no pressure what so ever. :)
